
=head1 NAME

term_map

=head1 DESCRIPTION

External terms which can be mapped to GCIS identifiers via a relationship.

=head1 FIELDS

 term_identifier (character varying) - The term ID (UUID).
 relationship_identifier (character varying) - The relationship between the term and the gcid.
 gcid (character varying) - The GCIS identifier (URI) to which this term is mapped.
 description (character varying) - A description for the GCID (optional).
 timestamp (timestamp(3) without time zone) - The timestamp this relationship was asserted.


=head1 SCHEMA

                                                                 Table "gcis_metadata.term_map"
          Column          |              Type              |   Modifiers   | Storage  | Stats target |                       Description                       
 -------------------------+--------------------------------+---------------+----------+--------------+---------------------------------------------------------
  term_identifier         | character varying              | not null      | extended |              | The term ID (UUID).
  relationship_identifier | character varying              | not null      | extended |              | The relationship between the term and the gcid.
  gcid                    | character varying              | not null      | extended |              | The GCIS identifier (URI) to which this term is mapped.
  description             | character varying              |               | extended |              | A description for the GCID (optional).
  timestamp               | timestamp(3) without time zone | default now() | plain    |              | The timestamp this relationship was asserted.
 Indexes:
     "term_map_pkey" PRIMARY KEY, btree (term_identifier, relationship_identifier, gcid)
 Check constraints:
     "ck_gcid" CHECK (length(gcid::text) > 0)
 Foreign-key constraints:
     "term_map_relationship_fkey" FOREIGN KEY (relationship_identifier) REFERENCES relationship(identifier) ON UPDATE CASCADE ON DELETE RESTRICT
     "term_map_term_fkey" FOREIGN KEY (term_identifier) REFERENCES term(identifier) ON UPDATE CASCADE ON DELETE CASCADE
 Triggers:
     audit_trigger_row AFTER INSERT OR DELETE OR UPDATE ON term_map FOR EACH ROW EXECUTE PROCEDURE audit.if_modified_func('true')
     audit_trigger_stm AFTER TRUNCATE ON term_map FOR EACH STATEMENT EXECUTE PROCEDURE audit.if_modified_func('true')
 Has OIDs: no
 

=cut
